item.title: By: Lorraine @ Not Quite Nigella
item.dc:creator: Lorraine @ Not Quite Nigella
item.description: Absolutely not too close to Winter Anita! I l love the gorgeous reddy pink shade. We've still got a few warm days left right? :D
item.content:encoded: Absolutely not too close to Winter Anita! I l love the gorgeous reddy pink shade. We’ve still got a few warm days left right? ðŸ˜€

item.title: By: Simon
item.dc:creator: Simon
item.description: I don't think there is ever a bad time to post about sorbets, icecreams and such. Case in point, it's a cold, dreary day outside but I feel like some of that sorbet now :)
item.content:encoded: I don’t think there is ever a bad time to post about sorbets, icecreams and such. Case in point, it’s a cold, dreary day outside but I feel like some of that sorbet now ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: lisa (dandysugar)
item.dc:creator: lisa (dandysugar)
item.description: Brilliant color! This is perfect for this great weather we are having here. I love making sorbet but I don't have an ice cream maker so it takes a lot of extra work for me!
item.content:encoded: Brilliant color! This is perfect for this great weather we are having here. I love making sorbet but I don’t have an ice cream maker so it takes a lot of extra work for me!

item.title: By: Trissa
item.dc:creator: Trissa
item.description: Brilliant Anita! Very handy for you to come up with sorbet! I always assumed I had to use fresh raspberries to make sorbet which is really quite prohibitive but knowing I can use frozen - I'll have to try it before the weather gets colder!
item.content:encoded: Brilliant Anita! Very handy for you to come up with sorbet! I always assumed I had to use fresh raspberries to make sorbet which is really quite prohibitive but knowing I can use frozen – I’ll have to try it before the weather gets colder!

item.title: By: FFichiban
item.dc:creator: FFichiban
item.description: Love the vivid colour of your sorbet! Perfect for this weather (or any weather) since it is cooling down now :)
item.content:encoded: Love the vivid colour of your sorbet! Perfect for this weather (or any weather) since it is cooling down now ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Julia @ MÃ©langer
item.dc:creator: Julia @ MÃ©langer
item.description: When I lived in Boston, it could be -20 out and people were still lining up for ice-cream. So I say it doesn't matter what the weather is doing. Hot or cold. Sorbets and ice-creams can be enjoyed anytime. The texture and richness of colour of your sorbet is fantastic!
item.content:encoded: When I lived in Boston, it could be -20 out and people were still lining up for ice-cream. So I say it doesn’t matter what the weather is doing. Hot or cold. Sorbets and ice-creams can be enjoyed anytime. The texture and richness of colour of your sorbet is fantastic!

item.title: By: mademoiselle dÃ©licieuse
item.dc:creator: mademoiselle dÃ©licieuse
item.description: Love it! And love making my own sorbet...really should get an ice-cream churner so that I don't have to keep using my mini-processor and churning in batches though =p
item.content:encoded: Love it! And love making my own sorbet…really should get an ice-cream churner so that I don’t have to keep using my mini-processor and churning in batches though =p

item.title: By: Betty @ The Hungry Girl
item.dc:creator: Betty @ The Hungry Girl
item.description: It's never too hot/cold to post anything of the sorbet/ice cream variety! I love the colour!
item.content:encoded: It’s never too hot/cold to post anything of the sorbet/ice cream variety! I love the colour!
